title: Judar and the Ifrit’s Daughter

source_text.text:
Judar, a fisherman, frees an ifrit’s daughter who is forced to guard treasure. She offers to flee with him and hands him henna, millet, and a flask of oil to cast if her father pursues.
They escape the cave with riches. The ifrit pursues in a storm of fire.
Judar throws the henna; a choking fog rolls in. He throws the millet; it becomes a swarm of birds that peck and blind the ifrit. He throws the oil; it erupts into a wall of flame. Beaten, the ifrit withdraws.
Judar and the ifrit’s daughter settle in the city and wed; she is freed from her father’s service.

source_text_persian.text: جُدار دختر افریتی را آزاد می‌کند و با او می‌گریزد. حنا مه می‌شود، ارزن به گلهٔ پرندگان کورکننده، و روغن به دیوار آتش بدل می‌شود و افریت عقب می‌ماند. آن دو با گنج به شهر می‌روند و عروسی می‌کنند.

thinking_process: Nights-derived magic-flight: helper gives three objects; hero throws them to halt a supernatural pursuer.

motif.obstacle_thrower: Judar throws each object while the ifrit’s daughter rides with him.
